word: M. E. Cady Not to Be Blamed for Actions of Previous Administrators at Healdsburg. (Written to M. E. Cady, September 7, 1903, from "Elmshaven," Sanitarium, California.) I am sorry that I could not see you. For some days I have been afflicted, and I hardly know how far I dare tax my strength by venturing to add to the perplexing burdens I am now carrying. My mind has been very severely taxed of late.
